void vrpn_Endpoint_IP::clearBuffers ( void   )  [virtual]

Empties out the TCP and UDP send buffers.

Needed by vrpn_FileConnection to get at {udp,tcp}NumOut.

Implements vrpn_Endpoint.

int  port

Connects d_udpSocket to the specified address and port; returns 0 on success, sets status to BROKEN and returns -1 on failure.

void vrpn_Endpoint_IP::drop_connection ( void   )  [virtual]

Should only be called by vrpn_Connection::drop_connection(), since there's more housecleaning to do at that level.

I suppose that argues against separating this function out.

Implements vrpn_Endpoint.

Sends the magic cookie and other information to its peer.

It is called by both the client and server setup routines.

timeval vrpn_Endpoint_IP::d_last_connect_attempt
char* vrpn_Endpoint_IP::d_NICaddress [protected]
int vrpn_Endpoint_IP::d_remote_port_number
vrpn_bool vrpn_Endpoint_IP::d_tcp_only

For connections made through firewalls or NAT with the tcp: URL, we do not want to allow the endpoints on either end to open a UDP link to their counterparts.

If this is the case, then this flag should be set to true.

SOCKET vrpn_Endpoint_IP::d_udpInboundSocket [protected]

Inbound unreliable messages come here.

Need one for each due to different clock synchronization for each; we need to know which server each message is from. XXX Now that we don't need multiple clocks, can we collapse this?
